New Records: Max Fried pitched three-hit ball over 8 2/3 innings, allowing only three hits and two runs.
Sean Murphy hit a two-run homer in the fourth inning.
Key Match Events: Marcell Ozuna scored an insurance run in the eighth inning after a throwing error by Salvador Perez.
The Kansas City Royals celebrated their first postseason berth since 2015 after the Minnesota Twins lost to the Baltimore Orioles.
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals had their magic number at one to clinch an AL wild-card berth before the game.
Max Fried acknowledged the significance of the game as potentially his final start with the Braves.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Fried expressed gratitude for his performance and the win, noting the emotional moment of leaving the field.
The Royals' players celebrated their playoff qualification in the visitors' clubhouse.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves' Reynaldo López was set to start the next game after being activated from the injured list.
The Royals' Vinnie Pasquantino was rehabilitating from a broken thumb.
Others: The game was the first career start for Max Fried against the Royals.
The series continued with Seth Lugo and Reynaldo López scheduled to pitch.
